stream_context.summary: Kaze re-works Course 12’s “mine” section, replacing an entire sub-area with a new Wild-West train station and a Boshi quick-draw event. During the stream he iterates on free-flow platforming inside the Goomba gang’s mine-hideout, places red coins, adds fireplaces for lighting, and plans rideable minecarts to finish traversal. He simultaneously tackles compiler warnings and tests on a private Project 64 Legacy build.

development_findings.summary: Removed one sub-area of Course 12; the train station is now placed right at the course entrance.
development_findings.quote: I made some big restructures in course 12… we removed one area and instead the train station is right here now.

development_findings.summary: Introduced a Boshi Wild-West ‘quick-draw’ boss: timed B-button duel, custom cut-scene, rewards a star, replaces the trench-coat Goombas.
development_findings.quote: There’s gonna be a countdown and you have to press B before he does to kill him, and then he gives you a star and he’s like, ‘I’m so sorry, I’ll stop being a bandit.’

development_findings.summary: Mine section theme: Goomba bandit hide-out with cork guns, campfires, wobbling platforms, curved bridges and rideable minecarts whose momentum lets players reach higher ledges.
development_findings.quote: You can step on the minecart and then they will drive you down… then jump off the minecart and use the inertia to land over here.

development_findings.summary: Red-coin star is ‘boot-less’; coins are distributed across areas via B-parameters. Final placements include fireplaces and hard-to-see alcoves.
development_findings.quote: The red coin stars are bootless… I have to give them B-parameters so they can be across areas.

development_findings.summary: Engine/optimization: considering converting spatial linked lists into arrays at level-boot for faster collision; geometry is batched by material and export order to improve N64 performance.
Lighting: custom low-poly fireplace (≈200 tris) with animated particles; per-area draw distance manually lifted for fire VFX.
development_findings.quote: I wanna make the fireplace a little smaller and add a bit of lighting to it… this will be graphics in 2013 for sure.

development_findings.summary: Technical hurdle: only remaining compiler warning is ‘fp register bound to multiple values’ across threads; pragma system-header failed to silence it.
development_findings.quote: I fixed all the warnings but this one I cannot fix… on every thread this register has a different value.

development_findings.summary: Uses a private in-development ‘Project 64 Legacy’ (1.6.2) emulator—same UI as 1.6 but with new emulation core, no audio crackle, fewer crashes.
development_findings.quote: Basically there is a project called Project 64 Legacy… audio crackling is gone, performance is better and it doesn’t crash like 1.6 does.

development_findings.summary: Next immediate task: program the minecarts and finish Goomba AI before moving to visual polish.
development_findings.quote: We will continue the minecarts next time until next Saturday.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is increasingly frustrated by repeated emulator advice from viewers, which makes him ‘hate emulators’.
context_findings.quote: I’m a little bit on edge about people recommending me emulators… that’s why I’m starting to hate emulators.

context_findings.summary: Personal drive: sets aggressive goals, even in fitness; down 17 lbs in six weeks but admits to over-cutting and getting injured.
context_findings.quote: I set a goal and I want to reach all my goals immediately, so I just work towards my goals with no exceptions.

context_findings.summary: Game-design philosophy: dislikes most boss fights, prefers open, player-controlled challenges; values ‘new concepts’ over polished familiarity.
context_findings.quote: What I look for in games is new concepts… boss fights are usually my least favorite part of any game.

context_findings.summary: Humorous but tense banter with collaborator Lilaa (calls her ‘built like a roach’), shows informal team culture.

biobak.summary: Working on a ‘Biobak re-work’ of course visuals that will ‘instantly make the forest better’.
biobak.quote: You’re already looking forward to the Biobak rework?… it’s going to make the force instantly much better.

zeina.summary: Appears in chat; no project input this stream, mostly personal banter (hairline, bowling).

key_stories.title: Course 12 Overhaul & Boshi Duel
key_stories.summary: Kaze felt Course 12 was weak. He removed an entire area, moved the train station to the start, and conceived a Boshi quick-draw event that awards a star.
key_stories.process: Deleted old section, rebuilt entrance, scripted a Wild-West cut-scene where Mario must out-draw Boshi.
key_stories.outcome: Level now ‘good’; sets visual tone and unique boss interaction.
key_stories.key_quote: I realized the course is not very good, and I think now it is good.

key_stories.title: Stubborn Compiler Warning
key_stories.summary: Kaze eliminated all compiler warnings except one about the fp register conflicting across threads.
key_stories.process: Tried pragma system header and other suppressions; discussed with chat.
key_stories.key_quote: That warning cannot be ignored… On every thread, this register has a different value.

key_stories.title: Adopting Project 64 Legacy
key_stories.summary: Standard PJ64 1.6 kept crashing; Kaze switched to a private Legacy build.
key_stories.challenge: Frequent emulator crashes and audio crackle during testing.
key_stories.process: Downloaded in-development 1.6.2 build retaining classic UI but new core.
key_stories.outcome: Crashes solved, better accuracy, continues daily dev.
key_stories.key_quote: It might even properly support all the instructions now—very, very useful.

key_stories.title: Minecart Flow & Red-Coin Placement
key_stories.summary: Needed smoother traversal and final red-coin spots in the mine hideout.
key_stories.challenge: Some sections were dead-ends and last two red coins lacked ideas.
key_stories.process: Designed curved bridge, fireplaces, and planned rideable minecarts that give momentum; placed eighth coin above a firepit.
key_stories.outcome: Traversal loop feels fluid; red-coin star finalized; minecarts scheduled for next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe players should go in here, ride the minecart, jump off using the inertia, and land over here.

open_questions.context: Outlined cut-scene and timing mechanic but no technical details.
questions: How will the quick-draw timing be coded on N64?
Will Boshi reuse existing animations or require new ones from Zeina?
What narrative purpose does this duel serve in Course 12?

open_questions.context: Minecarts will ‘carry inertia’ so Mario can launch onto distant platforms.
questions: What physics model will you use to preserve momentum?
Any performance risks with moving platforms and collision?
Timeline for completing this feature?

open_questions.context: Goombas will wield cork guns and patrol the hideout.
questions: What new behavior scripts are planned for the cork-gun Goombas?
Will their AI differ from standard Goombas?
Any special animations or sound design needed?

open_questions.context: Kaze teased that Biobak’s update will ‘instantly’ improve the forest.
questions: Which assets or levels is Biobak overhauling first?
What workflow do Kaze and Biobak follow for integrating new art?
How do they meet N64 texture limits?

open_questions.context: Chat suggested converting linked lists to arrays during level boot to speed collision.
questions: Is the team adopting this idea?
Any benchmarks comparing current and proposed methods?
Could memory fragmentation become an issue on real hardware?

open_questions.context: Kaze mentioned an unfinished ‘Raytracing64’ plugin that could ‘change a lot of things’.
questions: Do you plan to support this plugin at release?
What visual gains vs performance costs on real N64 hardware?
Will players be encouraged to use specific emulators?

open_questions.context: Only red-coin star is bootless; others still eject Mario.
questions: What design logic dictates which stars boot the player?
Will later courses use more bootless stars?
Any concern about breaking speedrun routing?
